param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: GET
method.doc: To retrieve the current front-end load balancer configuration with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the FELB file resource URI.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Specifies whether the front-end load balancer is enabled.

param.name: debug
param.doc: Designates whether additional debug messages are sent to the security log file.

param.name: ha
param.doc: Describes the configured HA settings

param.name: logging
param.doc: Describes the configured logging settings

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Describes the configured SSL settings

param.name: services
param.doc: Describes the configured services.

param.name: attributes
param.doc: Describes the configured services.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Specifies whether HA is enabled.

param.name: is_primary
param.doc: Specifies whether the role of the local server is the primary or the backup.

param.name: interface
param.doc: Specifies the interface that will be used to communicate with the paired server.

param.name: remote
param.doc: Specifies the address of the paired HA server.

param.name: port
param.doc: Specifies the port over which the health check should be sent.

param.name: health_check_interval
param.doc: Specifies the number of seconds between health check messages sent between the primary and backup servers.

param.name: health_check_timeout
param.doc: Specifies the number of seconds a load balancer must fail to respond to health check messages before triggering a fail over to the alternate load balancer.

param.name: local
param.doc: Specifies whether logging will be sent to a local file or remote syslog server.

param.name: remote_address
param.doc: Specifies the address of a remote syslog server that will receive logging information from the HA proxy process.

param.name: remote_port
param.doc: Specifies the port that the remote syslog server is listening on.

param.name: remote_facility
param.doc: Specifies the remote syslog facility.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Specifies whether or not SSL is enabled.

param.name: keyfile
param.doc: Specifies the name of the keyfile that will be used when negotiating SSL connections.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: Specifies whether the new service is enabled.

param.name: name
param.doc: Specifies the name of the new service. The service name may only contain alpha-numeric characters and the special characters ' ', '-', and '_'.

param.name: address
param.doc: Specifies the IP address that connects this service to the public network.

param.name: port
param.doc: Specifies the port on which this service listens.

param.name: netmask
param.doc: Specifies the network mask to be applied to the IP address for the service.

param.name: interface
param.doc: Specifies the appliance interface on which the new service connects to the public network. The value must be one of the application interface labels (1.1, 1.2, etc.).

param.name: scheduler
param.doc: Specifies the scheduling algorithm for distributing jobs to the real servers. The choices are: round-robin, static-round-robin, least-conn, source-hash.

param.name: health_check_interval
param.doc: Specifies the number of seconds between consecutive health checks of a server.

param.name: rise
param.doc: Specifies the number of consecutive successful health checks before a server is considered active.

param.name: fall
param.doc: Specifies the number of consecutive unsuccessful health checks before a server is considered inactive.

param.name: layer
param.doc: Specifies the load balancer layer configuration.

param.name: attributes
param.doc: Specifies the service level name/value configuration data.

param.name: servers
param.doc: Describes the real servers configured for this service.

param.name: name
param.doc: Specifies the name of the configuration attribute.

param.name: value
param.doc: Specifies the value of the configuration attribute.

param.name: type
param.doc: Specifies the layer type that the load balancer will run at. Must be either layer4 or layer7.

param.name: layer7_secure
param.doc: Specifies whether or not layer 7 SSL is used for this virtual server. This parameter is required if type is set to layer7.

param.name: layer7_ssl_label
param.doc: Specifies the label of the certificate that should be used when establishing a layer 7 SSL connection. This parameter is only valid if type is set to layer7.

param.name: layer7_cookie
param.doc: Specifies the name of the cookie that is used to maintain session affinity for layer 7 load balancing. This parameter is required if type is set to layer7.

param.name: id
param.doc: Specifies a unique identifier for this server.

param.name: active
param.doc: Specifies whether the new server is active.

param.name: address
param.doc: Specifies the IP address for the real server.

param.name: port
param.doc: Specifies the port that this server is listening on.

param.name: weight
param.doc: Specifies an integer that represents the processing capacity of this server relative to that of other real servers. For example, a server assigned 2000 has twice the capacity of a server assigned 1000. The weighted scheduling algorithms adjust this number dynamically based on workload.

param.name: secure
param.doc: Specifies whether or not SSL/TLS is used for this server. This parameter is optional and defaults to false.

param.name: ssllabel
param.doc: Specifies the label of the client certificate that should be sent when establishing a SSL/TLS connection. This parameter is optional and only valid if secure is "true". The default is "" (do not send client certificate).

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.

response.doc: An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: message
param.doc: The error message.
